articles.description: This is my personal blog where I write about anything that interests me!

Nesys
Nesys is an NES emulator Iâ€™m writing in Rust. It is a development
exercise. It forces me to write better and more idiomatic Rust (the

SICP and Scheme
SICP stands for the â€œStructure and Interpretation of Computer
Programsâ€ and itâ€™s bloody ridiculously good. It is essentially a course
in what Iâ€™d like to call â€œthe essence of computationâ€. Thereâ€™s no way to

Category Theory
Category Theory is a branch of mathematics and computer science that
allows us to mathematically model practically any program. This
allows us to write unimaginably robust and extensible code. Iâ€™m reading
Category Theory
for Programmers and recemmend it to anybody who wishes to dive into
the absolute depths of abstraction. Besides, itâ€™s good for the
mathematical muscles! ðŸ˜‰
DSA and Competitive
Programming
Iâ€™m currently working very hard to get better at DSA-based problems.
Iâ€™m currently super into trees and graphs and have been solving a lot of
problems related to them. To follow my CP progress, do checkout my CP Repository
